Hello!

I'm Ris. I'm a non-binary visual communicator who likes to draw, design, animate, code, and eat. Most of the time, you'll likely find me doing a combination of the above.

My pronouns are they/them (English), iel/il (French), ‰ªñ (Chinese).

Some things I've worked on

I'm currently serving as a Board Director for Humainologie, a Calgary-based organization whose mission is to centre people facing systemic barriers by amplifying their stories and celebrating their humanity.

I‚Äôm part of the happen stance art collective, a crew of artists, illustrators, writers and comic loving nerds in so-called Vancouver. Our work spans a range of mediums including stickers, comics, printmaking, book arts, illustration, painting and design, tied together by our collectively held interest in independent artistic expression.

In the past, I‚Äôve designed and developed responsive, accessible interfaces for clients such as Alberta Health Services (AHS), Calgary Distress Centre, Wood‚Äôs Homes, TELUS Spark, ATB, and American Express Global Business Travel (Amex GBT).

I‚Äôve created illustrations and icons for clients like Nature Conservancy of Canada (NCC), Wood‚Äôs Homes, Arts Commons, and DCBank. I was a regular contributor as an illustrator to Big Kitty Magazine, a publication in Calgary that showcases and focuses on amplifying marginalized voices in local art, music, and culture.
